pageContext.claim: “And, as you know, we have 26,000 Mexico troops on our border. And they're also bringing their numbers way down. It's -- we were with the Commissioner a little while ago, the Secretary, and it's down over 50 percent from last year.”
pageContext.analysis: U.S. Customs and Border Patrol reports apprehensions have decreased by more than half since their peak in May 2019, but there are still thousand more than in September of 2018.
